member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ChunkingCookieManager
member.summary: This handles cookies that are limited by per cookie length. It breaks down long cookies for responses, and reassembles them from requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ChunkingCookieManager.ChunkSize
member.summary:
The maximum size of cookie to send back to the client. If a cookie exceeds this size it will be broken down into multiple cookies. Set this value to null to disable this behavior. The default is 4090 characters, which is supported by all common browsers.
Note that browsers may also have limits on the total size of all cookies per domain, and on the number of cookies per domain.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ChunkingCookieManager.ThrowForPartialCookies
member.summary: Throw if not all chunks of a cookie are available on a request for re-assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ChunkingCookieManager.GetRequestCookie(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: Get the reassembled cookie. Non chunked cookies are returned normally. Cookies with missing chunks just have their "chunks:XX" header returned.
member.returns: The reassembled cookie, if any, or null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ChunkingCookieManager.AppendResponseCookie(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Appends a new response cookie to the Set-Cookie header. If the cookie is larger than the given size limit then it will be broken down into multiple cookies as follows: Set-Cookie: CookieName=chunks:3; path=/ Set-Cookie: CookieNameC1=Segment1; path=/ Set-Cookie: CookieNameC2=Segment2; path=/ Set-Cookie: CookieNameC3=Segment3; path=/

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ChunkingCookieManager.DeleteCookie(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Deletes the cookie with the given key by setting an expired state. If a matching chunked cookie exists on the request, delete each chunk.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults
member.summary: Default values related to cookie-based authentication middleware

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: The default value used for CookieAuthenticationOptions.AuthenticationScheme

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults.CookiePrefix
member.summary: The prefix used to provide a default CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieName

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults.LoginPath
member.summary: The default value used by CookieAuthenticationMiddleware for the CookieAuthenticationOptions.LoginPath

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults.LogoutPath
member.summary: The default value used by CookieAuthenticationMiddleware for the CookieAuthenticationOptions.LogoutPath

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AccessDeniedPath
member.summary: The default value used by CookieAuthenticationMiddleware for the CookieAuthenticationOptions.AccessDeniedPath

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationDefaults.ReturnUrlParameter
member.summary: The default value of the CookieAuthenticationOptions.ReturnUrlParameter

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions
member.summary: Contains the options used by the CookiesAuthenticationMiddleware

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of the options initialized with the default values

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieName
member.summary: Determines the cookie name used to persist the identity. The default value is ".AspNet.Cookies". This value should be changed if you change the name of the AuthenticationScheme, especially if your system uses the cookie authentication middleware multiple times.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieDomain
member.summary: Determines the domain used to create the cookie. Is not provided by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookiePath
member.summary: Determines the path used to create the cookie. The default value is "/" for highest browser compatability.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieHttpOnly
member.summary: Determines if the browser should allow the cookie to be accessed by client-side javascript. The default is true, which means the cookie will only be passed to http requests and is not made available to script on the page.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieSecure
member.summary: Determines if the cookie should only be transmitted on HTTPS request. The default is to limit the cookie to HTTPS requests if the page which is doing the SignIn is also HTTPS. If you have an HTTPS sign in page and portions of your site are HTTP you may need to change this value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.DataProtectionProvider
member.summary: If set this will be used by the CookieAuthenticationMiddleware for data protection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.ExpireTimeSpan
member.summary: Controls how much time the cookie will remain valid from the point it is created. The expiration information is in the protected cookie ticket. Because of that an expired cookie will be ignored even if it is passed to the server after the browser should have purged it

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.SlidingExpiration
member.summary: The SlidingExpiration is set to true to instruct the middleware to re-issue a new cookie with a new expiration time any time it processes a request which is more than halfway through the expiration window.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.LoginPath
member.summary: The LoginPath property informs the middleware that it should change an outgoing 401 Unauthorized status code into a 302 redirection onto the given login path. The current url which generated the 401 is added to the LoginPath as a query string parameter named by the ReturnUrlParameter. Once a request to the LoginPath grants a new SignIn identity, the ReturnUrlParameter value is used to redirect the browser back to the url which caused the original unauthorized status code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.LogoutPath
member.summary: If the LogoutPath is provided the middleware then a request to that path will redirect based on the ReturnUrlParameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.AccessDeniedPath
member.summary: The AccessDeniedPath property informs the middleware that it should change an outgoing 403 Forbidden status code into a 302 redirection onto the given path.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.ReturnUrlParameter
member.summary: The ReturnUrlParameter determines the name of the query string parameter which is appended by the middleware when a 401 Unauthorized status code is changed to a 302 redirect onto the login path. This is also the query string parameter looked for when a request arrives on the login path or logout path, in order to return to the original url after the action is performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.Events
member.summary: The Provider may be assigned to an instance of an object created by the application at startup time. The middleware calls methods on the provider which give the application control at certain points where processing is occurring. If it is not provided a default instance is supplied which does nothing when the methods are called.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.TicketDataFormat
member.summary: The TicketDataFormat is used to protect and unprotect the identity and other properties which are stored in the cookie value. If it is not provided a default data handler is created using the data protection service contained in the IApplicationBuilder.Properties. The default data protection service is based on machine key when running on ASP.NET, and on DPAPI when running in a different process.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.SystemClock
member.summary: For testing purposes only.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieManager
member.summary:
The component used to get cookies from the request or set them on the response.
ChunkingCookieManager will be used by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions.SessionStore
member.summary: An optional container in which to store the identity across requests. When used, only a session identifier is sent to the client. This can be used to mitigate potential problems with very large identities.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSecureOption
member.summary: Determines how the identity cookie's security property is set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSecureOption.SameAsRequest
member.summary: If the URI that provides the cookie is HTTPS, then the cookie will only be returned to the server on subsequent HTTPS requests. Otherwise if the URI that provides the cookie is HTTP, then the cookie will be returned to the server on all HTTP and HTTPS requests. This is the default value because it ensures HTTPS for all authenticated requests on deployed servers, and also supports HTTP for localhost development and for servers that do not have HTTPS support.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSecureOption.Never
member.summary: CookieOptions.Secure is never marked true. Use this value when your login page is HTTPS, but other pages on the site which are HTTP also require authentication information. This setting is not recommended because the authentication information provided with an HTTP request may be observed and used by other computers on your local network or wireless connection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSecureOption.Always
member.summary: CookieOptions.Secure is always marked true. Use this value when your login page and all subsequent pages requiring the authenticated identity are HTTPS. Local development will also need to be done with HTTPS urls.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieManager
member.summary: This is used by the CookieAuthenticationMiddleware to process request and response cookies. It is abstracted from the normal cookie APIs to allow for complex operations like chunking.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieManager.GetRequestCookie(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a cookie of the given name from the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieManager.AppendResponseCookie(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Append the given cookie to the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieManager.DeleteCookie(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,System.String,Microsoft.AspNet.Http.CookieOptions)
member.summary: Append a delete cookie to the response.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ITicketStore
member.summary: This provides an abstract storage mechanic to preserve identity information on the server while only sending a simple identifier key to the client. This is most commonly used to mitigate issues with serializing large identities into cookies.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ITicketStore.StoreAsync(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationTicket)
member.summary: Store the identity ticket and return the associated key.
member.returns: The key that can be used to retrieve the identity later.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ITicketStore.RenewAsync(System.String,Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationTicket)
member.summary: Tells the store that the given identity should be updated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ITicketStore.RetrieveAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves an identity from the store for the given key.
member.param: The key associated with the identity.
member.returns: The identity associated with the given key, or if not found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ITicketStore.RemoveAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the identity associated with the given key.
member.param: The key associated with the identity.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationEvents
member.summary: This default implementation of the ICookieAuthenticationEvents may be used if the application only needs to override a few of the interface methods. This may be used as a base class or may be instantiated directly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieRedirectContext
member.summary: Context passed when a Challenge, SignIn, or SignOut causes a redirect in the cookie middleware

member.summary: Creates a new context object.

member.summary: Gets or Sets the URI used for the redirect operation.

member.summary: Context object passed to the ICookieAuthenticationEvents method SignedIn.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the context object.

member.summary: The name of the AuthenticationScheme creating a cookie

member.summary: Context object passed to the ICookieAuthenticationEvents method SigningIn.
Creates a new instance of the context object.
member.param: Initializes options for the authentication cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSigningInContext.AuthenticationScheme
member.summary: The name of the AuthenticationScheme creating a cookie

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSigningInContext.Principal
member.summary: Contains the claims about to be converted into the outgoing cookie. May be replaced or altered during the SigningIn call.

member.summary: Contains the extra data about to be contained in the outgoing cookie. May be replaced or altered during the SigningIn call.

member.summary: The options for creating the outgoing cookie. May be replace or altered during the SigningIn call.

member.summary: The options for creating the outgoing cookie. May be replace or altered during the SigningOut call.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext
member.summary: Context object passed to the ICookieAuthenticationProvider method ValidatePrincipal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNet.Http.HttpContext,Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.AuthenticationTicket,Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieAuthenticationOptions)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the context object.
member.param: Contains the initial values for identity and extra data

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext.Principal
member.summary: Contains the claims principal arriving with the request. May be altered to change the details of the authenticated user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext.Properties
member.summary: Contains the extra meta-data arriving with the request ticket. May be altered.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext.ShouldRenew
member.summary: If true, the cookie will be renewed

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext.ReplacePrincipal(System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal)
member.summary: Called to replace the claims principal. The supplied principal will replace the value of the Principal property, which determines the identity of the authenticated request.
member.param: The identity used as the replacement

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext.RejectPrincipal
member.summary: Called to reject the incoming principal. This may be done if the application has determined the account is no longer active, and the request should be treated as if it was anonymous.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents
member.summary: Specifies callback methods which the invokes to enable developer control over the authentication process. />

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.ValidatePrincipal(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieValidatePrincipalContext)
member.summary: Called each time a request principal has been validated by the middleware. By implementing this method the application may alter or reject the principal which has arrived with the request.
member.param: Contains information about the login session as well as the user .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.SigningIn(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSigningInContext)
member.summary: Called when an endpoint has provided sign in information before it is converted into a cookie. By implementing this method the claims and extra information that go into the ticket may be altered.
member.param: Contains information about the login session as well as the user .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.SignedIn(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSignedInContext)
member.summary: Called when an endpoint has provided sign in information after it is converted into a cookie.
member.param: Contains information about the login session as well as the user .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.RedirectToLogout(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieRedirectContext)
member.summary: Called when a SignOut causes a redirect in the cookie middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.RedirectToLogin(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieRedirectContext)
member.summary: Called when a SignIn causes a redirect in the cookie middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.RedirectToReturnUrl(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieRedirectContext)
member.summary: Called when redirecting back to the return url in the cookie middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.RedirectToAccessDenied(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieRedirectContext)
member.summary: Called when an access denied causes a redirect in the cookie middleware.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.ICookieAuthenticationEvents.SigningOut(Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.CookieSigningOutContext)
member.summary: Called during the sign-out flow to augment the cookie cleanup process.
member.param: Contains information about the login session as well as information about the authentication cookie.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.Resources.Exception_CookieLimitTooSmall
member.summary: The cookie key and options are larger than ChunksSize, leaving no room for data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.Resources.FormatException_CookieLimitTooSmall
member.summary: The cookie key and options are larger than ChunksSize, leaving no room for data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Authentication.Cookies.Resources.Exception_ImcompleteChunkedCookie
member.summary: The chunked cookie is incomplete. Only {0} of the expected {1} chunks were found, totaling {2} characters. A client size limit may have been exceeded.

member.summary: The chunked cookie is incomplete. Only {0} of the expected {1} chunks were found, totaling {2} characters. A client size limit may have been exceeded.

member.returns: A reference to this instance after the operation has completed.

An action delegate to configure the provided .
